com.soa.policy.wspolicy.handler
Interface WSPHandlerFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimplePolicyHandlerFactory
public interface WSPHandlerFactory

This is the main interface for creating a policy handler based on WS-Policy. Since a WS Policy definintion can contain multiple policy choices, it is the job of each policy handler to identify the policy choice(s) that is suitable for the underlying SOAP message and process the message accordingly, see ChoiceAwarePolicyHandler. A helper class SimplePolicyHandlerFactory has been provided for the simple use cases when the processing logic of policy handlers are independent of which policy choice is selected.

Since:
6.0

Method Summary
 MessageHandler create(PolicyChoices policyChoices, HandlerContext context, HandlerRole role)
          Create a MessageHandler from a normalized set of policy choices.
 PolicyHandlerFactoryCapability getCapability()
          Return the capability of the handler factory with respected to the type of policy assertions it can process.
 

Method Detail

create

MessageHandler create(PolicyChoices policyChoices,
                      HandlerContext context,
                      HandlerRole role)
                      throws GException
Create a MessageHandler from a normalized set of policy choices.

Parameters:
policyChoices - The object containing information about normalized policy choices defined in a policy file.
context - The handler context.
role -
Returns:
A MessageHandler derived from the policy choices. The message handler should be able to match and process a given SOAP message based on the policy choices. It ususally should be a subclass of ChoiceAwarePolicyHandler. Return null if there is no processing required based on all the policy choices.
Throws:
GException

getCapability

PolicyHandlerFactoryCapability getCapability()
Return the capability of the handler factory with respected to the type of policy assertions it can process. The handler factory must not process any assertion that are not described in its capability.

Returns:
A object representing the capability of the handler factory. Return null if the handler factory will process all assertions in the policy.
